website_summaries.verdict: While these gloves are an attractive style for men that are quite warm, the trade-off is the quirky touchscreen fingers that occasionally fail to work as promised – OK for minor tasks, but awkward for major texting.
pros: These handsome men's texting gloves are crafted for warmth, as they are made with a real wool blend
Timberland is a brand known for cold-weather attire
cons: Touchscreen feature doesn't always work with all functions or devices
Occasional reports of seams coming loose

customer_reviews.title: Good for 30 degrees and above!
customer_reviews.text: I will start by saying that these gloves look nice and function with touch screens quite well. They are made of comfy and nice material. Other than that they are just okay. Living in Missouri where temps only get down to 5 degrees at the lowest they don’t keep your hands super warm. If it’s only 30 out hey are fine, anything less not so great.
customer_reviews.author: WillC1123

customer_reviews.title: c rating
customer_reviews.text: They fit well and work as expected. I'm typically a XXL glove guy to try to get an XL but these are true to size. They are thick as they look so don't thing your going to be banging out a 100 work essay with them on, but they will get you through those few finger swipes or letters reliably. I haven't tried them for warmth yet but they seem like they will be good. Follow up for Warmth they are a C at best. Just a quick 10 min outdoor car scrape off and my finger tips were frozen. Sorry folks, took my 4 start rating to a 2.5 star rating. Use liners in these and they work better.
customer_reviews.author: John from Ct

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my needs. I have been trying to find a pair of gloves for literally years that were warm, yet flexible. What ever I got either fit poorly and/or were so stiff that I couldn't do anything requiring dextarity. I gave up, but my wife found these for me. Nice and stretchy and easy to put on. They are warm, yet flexible as as such gloves could be. I don't know what they cost as they were a present, but I love them. I doubt if they would hold up for heavy work, but for every day work, driving, outdoor sports or just warming hands up on a cold morning, they are spot on.
customer_reviews.author: Richard S. Cummings

customer_reviews.title: Warm and Tech Savvy
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice gloves and the advertised "Touchscreen Technology" holds true. I can keep my hands warm and use my iPhone/iPad at the same time. One issue is the webbing between the thumb and first finger and my left hand rubs a bit. I have huge hands and ordered and XL. Beyond that, great buy.
customer_reviews.author: R. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great looking gloves
customer_reviews.text: My hubby has larger hands than most guys and he can wear these well because they have a little stretch to them. I bought him a pair for Christmas and they look great with his black coat. He recently lost the ones I bought him for Christmas and I bought him a replacement. Thank goodness they were still available. These gloves are great, honestly nice looking and warm.
customer_reviews.author: Pisces223

customer_reviews.title: Warmth, not so much on touch screen function
customer_reviews.text: Does the job of providing warmth - though that whole "touch screen technology" is a bit overblown. Yes, it does work IF you can tap the right "thing". Swiping is fine, but some swipe actions will also succumb to "targeting" - e.g. if you have a lock screen pattern that's a bit close/overlapping, oh, boy, it'll feel like a game of "can I actually do this?" :)
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Do the job, but not very good for really cold weather.
customer_reviews.text: Needed a pair of gloves for when I needed to use my phone. These gloves aren't very insulated and there isn't really any lining on the inside, so I'd recommend these gloves only if you live in an area that rarely sees temperatures under 20 degrees. I live in ND so that's not the case for me... Anything below 20 degrees will eat through these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Jake A

customer_reviews.title: Decent gloves!
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend was always complaining about gloves. He's got a really nice pair of leather ones but was looking for another pair that were more day to day and it seemed that all he could find were really cheap ones. So I got him a pair of these and they turned out to be the perfect pair! He said "I feel like I could fly an x wing fighter in these". Haha
customer_reviews.author: komelina

customer_reviews.title: but I wouldn't wear them for things like skiing, shoveling
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are adequate for freezing temp and above, but I wouldn't wear them for things like skiing, shoveling, etc. They're definitely warmer than other touchscreen gloves I've used, but the trade-off is the touchscreen fingertips don't work very well. The screen does respond, but the gloves don't allow for the finer control needed on most smartphones. All in all, I'd say these are a good cool weather glove and a poor touchscreen glove. Take that as you will.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel A. Opp

customer_reviews.title: Good compromise for warmth and smart phone operation.
customer_reviews.text: The ability to use my smart phone touch screen is pretty good with these gloves. Not perfect, but they are gloves after all. The pads should be a little longer down the finger, though. You need to have your fingers fully inside the glove to make the finger tip pad operate the touch screen. Also, the gloves are decently warm, but not "toasty" warm. I find my fingers still get cold in these gloves compared to my winter gloves. But.... I cannot operate my phone in winter gloves, so I accept the compromise! The gloves have a good appearance and seem well constructed. Had the pads extended further down, i would have given 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: TB

customer_reviews.title: great gloves
customer_reviews.text: I really like these gloves. I ordered another pair for my girlfriend and another pair because my dog ate the first pair i ordered. These are pretty damm good if I ordered the pair 3x's all together.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best on the market for cold weather
customer_reviews.text: I've tried two other "warm winter" pairs of touch sensitive gloves. Either the beads that make then touch sensitive wear down...or they're so broad that they touch the screen in more than one place at once (on a mac, you can imagine the zooming horror at a zingle click). That being said...these guys are EXTREMELY warm. They are well fit (though best for larger hands) and are accurate enough to allow Swype keyboard entry and play games such as Fruit Ninja without feeling handicapped at all. I gave my old pair to my roommate...these are clutch.
customer_reviews.author: Ells

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, sturdy, and functional!
customer_reviews.text: I was not expecting to like these as much as I do. The fit is great, they are sturdy, and the capacitive fingers work well. The could be a little warmer, but I think that's the sacrifice you make for all of the pluses.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Bank

customer_reviews.title: This glove: all love.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, great fit. The touch screen finger tips are useful, but don't expect the same precision as bare fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Isaí

customer_reviews.title: Pretty warm and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Pretty warm and comfortable. The grey area on the outside is rough... keep in mind if you use it to, say, wipe a runny nose in the cold. :D The touchscreen-enabled fingers work well, although there is a lot of stitching at the end of the glove's fingers which makes it very difficult to be precise - but good enough to trigger a photo.
customer_reviews.author: Paul G

customer_reviews.title: Good Gloves!
customer_reviews.text: FITMENT: I usually wear 2XL in motocross gloves, but these gloves in the XL size fit perfectly. PROS: Fitment, looks. They aren't super warm, but I wasn't expecting super warm gloves; I'd say they're one step below a typical snow glove. CONS: They barely operate my iPhone, but I didn't really expect them to.
customer_reviews.author: J.A.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Gloves, could be warmer
customer_reviews.text: These are nice looking gloves and they work well with my smart phone. My only complaint is that they don't keep my fingers very warm. They work great for driving or just being out in the cold for a short time but if you plan to be out for longer you may want to find something a little warmer. These may work better for other people but I don't have very good circulation in my hands and fingers so I need something with more insulation.
customer_reviews.author: Randall L. Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Nice Gloves
customer_reviews.text: The Only Issue I Have With Them Is That The Finger End Where They Got The Plastic ‘Texting’ Part Gets Very Cold
customer_reviews.author: Dan The Man, The Marshmallow Man

customer_reviews.title: That they fit
customer_reviews.text: Sorry I just got them and tried them on. I will put them to the test tomorrow. They appear to be well made.
customer_reviews.author: D. R. Leino

customer_reviews.title: Probably best to wear above 50-degrees
customer_reviews.text: The gloves are comfortable and good looking. The fingers are padded on the side, so they fit good and snug. But, they are not so great at blocking the chill. I was wearing them the other day and it was maybe 48-degrees. They didn't really provide much protection at all from the chill. The price was good, they look nice and the touchscreen thing works, somewhat, but they just aren't very good at blocking cold weather.
customer_reviews.author: B. Mook

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Bad shipping method...
customer_reviews.text: The gloves work great.. I only give four stars because I work 2 jobs and am a full time student, so I am reliant on the tracking feature of my packages. I was alarmed when my package showed being delivered on the expected date when it wasn't on my porch, I thought someone had stolen my gloves!?! It actually turned out that my gloves hadn't been delivered yet... I'm really to tired to care after stressing so much but I hope that the seller takes this up with the shipping provider.. Although it was delivered within the time period, I was about to file a claim to amazon for a refund...
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Good quality gloves
customer_reviews.text: Good quality gloves, nice material worth the price in that sense but the touchscreen capability is pretty much non existent, you have to figure out what part of the finger will allow you to actually use your phone so by the end of it you are basically using your phone handicap. I don't regret buying the gloves though they are nice gloves for the cold. Just not for using your phone.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: My Papa loves these gloves. He does have a ...
customer_reviews.text: My Papa loves these gloves. He does have a little trouble with the touchscreen capability. I wore the gloves, and they are a bit fickle! But they keep his hands very warm , which he loves, he just is addicted to his iPad so the touch screen feature was what I was really going for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gave as gifts and each person was so pleased. They tend not to wear gloves unless it ...
customer_reviews.text: Gave as gifts and each person was so pleased. They tend not to wear gloves unless it is cold so they appreciated the warmth of the gloves and the smartphone feature.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Connelly

customer_reviews.title: Can wear them even when I'm using my smart phone - nice feature
customer_reviews.text: Can wear them even when I'm using my smart phone - nice feature! The eyelets on each glove made it easy to put together lanyards to prevent losing a glove - might market that myself.
customer_reviews.author: Willis Livesey

customer_reviews.title: Order larger than you think you need.
customer_reviews.text: Nice and soft but runs small and side seams are now opening...hardly any seam allowance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Have been using these gloves for around a month, still in great condition with no issues on index and thumb touchscreen interaction. Even in sub-freezing temperatures, my hands stayed nice and toasty. One word of caution: the fingertips on these gloves are somewhat tight on the pair I received, though they did widen out after a few weeks of use. Those with larger fingers/hands may want to look for a different pair of gloves or risk constriction.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Everts

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as Christmas gift for my husband. He says they keep his hands VERY warm and do function well on the Iphone touchscreen, as touted in the reviews. But also mentioned in the reviews was the fact that the THUMBS are disproportionately long, and this is also TRUE. He says this is not a big enough drawback to return the gloves, as they are WARM. And that, along with touchscreen capability, is why I ordered them. Overall, great gloves! Good value.
customer_reviews.author: Shooks

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice gloves
customer_reviews.text: These are nice gloves - a little thicker on the fingers than we would prefer. I guess it's a tradeoff - thicker material means less control in your fingertips but thinner material means less warmth. Overall pretty good though and should do the trick - for using the phone/tablet while outdoors in the winter!
customer_reviews.author: Sassy Molassey

customer_reviews.title: Very Warm Gloves
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I purchased these gloves. They fit perfectly(L) and you feel the warmth as you put them on. Bring on the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves, great price
customer_reviews.text: Cannot believe the low price for these gloves. Very well constructed, good material.
customer_reviews.author: L. Barlow

customer_reviews.title: Perfect as driving gloves.
customer_reviews.text: Needed a warm pair of driving gloves for this HOU winter! These were perfect for scraping ice and wearing until the car heater warmed everything up.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Walker

customer_reviews.title: ok but not very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Honestly just not very comfortable. They are fine for a lightweight glove but I can feel the stiching and its just not that comfy
customer_reviews.author: B. Epstein

customer_reviews.title: Only works  some of the time
customer_reviews.text: They don't work that well. Barely works even for turning pages in Kindle.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Killough

customer_reviews.title: Mine were missing the conductive finger patches
customer_reviews.text: So really these were just Timberland Men's Knit Gloves... An average pair of gloves without really much special to say about them. I had a pair of the ones with the touchscreen and those were nice though the touchscreen manipulation was a little bulky (nothing to be done about that, really. If you order these and receive what is advertised, you'll be much happier than I am.
customer_reviews.author: James Firth

customer_reviews.title: Loves them!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome gloves! They fit perfectly and are awesome to keep my Hubby hands warm during the winter. They are thick and well made. Hopefully they hold up all winter
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: not heavy duty, but they keep of the cold ...
customer_reviews.text: not heavy duty, but they keep of the cold when warming up the cars and scraping windows on a cold winter morning.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: love em
customer_reviews.text: bought these for my boyfriend so he can ride his four wheeler in the winter. nice sturdy quality and REAL timbs. package says they were originally 45$ so good deal!!!! I bought mens XL and idk if it will fit his hands cuz they're like freakishly huge but if not I'll give them to my little brother.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These were a gift... the recipient said ...
customer_reviews.text: These were a gift...the recipient said "these are SO soft !" ( 22 year old male ) and proceeded to wear them about the house for an hour Christmas morning as we opened more presents. WIN.
customer_reviews.author: FROC 2531

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking, semi-warm gloves.
customer_reviews.text: Gloves look great. They keep your hands adequately warm but wouldn't use them in extreme cold situations. The touchscreen capacitive fingertips are kind of a hit and miss. They work but not very well. Better than not working at all, I suppose.
customer_reviews.author: G. J.

customer_reviews.title: Big enough for large hands
customer_reviews.text: I know some reviewers have said that their hands were cold in these gloves...but I have had the opposite experience. They are warm and cozy and they fit my giant hands. They are well made and the smart phone fingertips....kind of work sometimes. All in all these gloves are keepers!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sakolsky

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but I expected something better
customer_reviews.text: First they do not warn my fingers as I want. And secondly I can't move my finger and do whatever I want. They are just ok... Not bad but I expected something better.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and quality
customer_reviews.text: Great fit and quality. Not quite as warm as others, but really appreciate being able to use my iPhone with them on.
customer_reviews.author: An/La

customer_reviews.title: A LITTLE SHORT FINGER TIP TO CUFF, BUT WARM
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for some gloves to wear while driving that would allow me to answer my phone. These are warm enough and the touchscreen fingers work fine, but they are a little short from the "finger tip to the cuff." Also, the cuff tends to turn under slightly. But, these were the best multi-purpose gloves that I have found.
customer_reviews.author: CDRUSNRET

customer_reviews.title: My brother loved these when I gave them to him as a ...
customer_reviews.text: My brother loved these when I gave them to him as a gift! Very comfortable and warm, and the fact that they can be used with touchscreens is great. Definitely would recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Connor

customer_reviews.title: I returned these, check out MUJJO Touch Screen Winter Gloves instead
customer_reviews.text: I ended up returning mine and instead getting MUJJO Touch Screen Winter Gloves, which are way better in touch screen use and warmth.
customer_reviews.author: Berj Alexanian

customer_reviews.title: these are the best. Great fit
customer_reviews.text: Over the years I've owned plenty of gloves. Without exception, these are the best. Great fit, comfortable, they move nicely with my hands, and the keep my hands warm. My hand get cold, painfully so, and these really help. They are a superb product!
customer_reviews.author: P.C. Tennen

customer_reviews.title: The gloves are warm but they make the thumb abnormally ...
customer_reviews.text: The gloves are warm but they make the thumb abnormally long so it defeats the purpose of having touchscreen gloves if you must use both hands.
customer_reviews.author: Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Not Good
customer_reviews.text: The gloves were oddly sized. they were long but the fingers were small. also, i did not like the touchscreen pads on the gloves, it was too clunky
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my son since these came so highly rated. He said they worked really well and fit perfectly. Not bulky but very warm!
customer_reviews.author: DaniLovestoShop

customer_reviews.title: They're warm but the material isn't super comfortable. They're only sort of waterproof
customer_reviews.text: They're warm but the material isn't super comfortable. They're only sort of waterproof. I wouldn't want to be stuck in the snow changing a tire with these gloves, but they're fine for driving or walking around.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonkat

customer_reviews.title: Toasty Fingers
customer_reviews.text: got a pair as a gift - had to have a 2nd pair - keeps fingers warm in the REAL cold weather!
customer_reviews.author: NORSKEE

customer_reviews.title: And they look good too, classic and simple with just enough of ...
customer_reviews.text: I have big hands, and most XL gloves are too tight or have fingers that are too short - but these fit very well. And they look good too, classic and simple with just enough of a unique design. Probably aren't the best for dealing with a lot of moisture, but they're thicker than I thought and hold up well in freezing temps.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C

customer_reviews.title: About expected, but still good.
customer_reviews.text: They are very comfortable and the fingertips interact well with my phone. They could be slightly warmer but for the price they do what I'd hoped for.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... decent pair of gloves but the stitching inside are annoying if you're trying to shovel snow or grab all ...
customer_reviews.text: They are a decent pair of gloves but the stitching inside are annoying if you're trying to shovel snow or grab all of the groceries from the trunk in one go.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: At $30, these are completely not worth the money to me. I thought I’d be safe by not going cheap. I was wrong. The one good thing about these is that the touchscreen fingertips work well. That was something I thought I’d like, but it’s still not as useful as I thought. Now, the bad. They’re not that warm. I was looking for something a little less insulating, but this took it too far. They’re not comfortable. From the pictures, you can see the numerous large seams on the fingers. They’re also not stretchy at all. They fit my hand reasonably well, so it wasn’t a problem for me, but others may have issues. Overall, I’d avoid these.
customer_reviews.author: John Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Great fit!
customer_reviews.text: Nice snug fit without being two tight also surprisingly warm for how light they are. Also the touch pads for smart phone use are very accurate when using the device.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic touch sensitive gloves
customer_reviews.text: I'm extremely picky about gloves and these are fantastic. They look even better in person than they do in these pictures and fit very snug (which I like). The touchscreen fingers are leather and work extremely well -- nearly as well as my own finger -- and I was able to type with my thumbs pretty easily.
customer_reviews.author: sbs

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: By far the most comfortable, and stylish, pair of gloves on the market!
customer_reviews.author: T. Hess

customer_reviews.title: gloves I can play pokemon go with
customer_reviews.text: these are great driving gloves and very good gloves for most applications except sub zero temps.
customer_reviews.author: jim nolan

customer_reviews.title: Warm hands make for a happy man
customer_reviews.text: Solid gloves. Look good, comfortable and warm! I didn't give it a four star because I thought the pad's on the fingers would work better on my smartphone. Kind of knit picking a little but hey you can't give everything 5 start. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Kehoe

customer_reviews.title: Timberland Gloves
customer_reviews.text: These are nice. The touch screen fingers work fine. I only gave 4 stars because there is no way you would be able to type/text accuratly on a smart phones keyboard. The gloves will keep my hands warm, and are not too bulky.
customer_reviews.author: familyman3

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: warm and touch screen function works good. A little large though
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: The large is a smallish fit and the inside seams ...
customer_reviews.text: The large is a smallish fit and the inside seams can irritate your fingers. For that reason, my husband didn't care for these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: M. Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Baby , it's cold outside.
customer_reviews.text: My son is an electrician and he is very happy with these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: FuFu mere

customer_reviews.title: Not for cold weather.
customer_reviews.text: If you are from Minnesota or someplace cold these gloves are not going to cut it by themselves. At 15 degrees they are good for maybe 10 to 15 minutes. Also the recommended sizing seems small. I should have ordered XLarge rather than Large.
customer_reviews.author: ddh

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my partner, and he is able to use his mobile device with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Rorie

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: They look nice and fit well. Haven't tried them out in the cold yet to see if they're warm enough
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: My dad was a big fan of these. They ...
customer_reviews.text: My dad was a big fan of these. They are light enough, still keep his hands warm and work very well with his window touch screen phone.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Probably a defect but they're otherwise great gloves.
customer_reviews.text: Right index finger on my gloves is slightly twisted, so the e-tip part tends to be on the side of my finger rather than on the bottom, so it's a pain to actually use these with electronic devices. Probably a defect but they're otherwise great gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Allyan Pate

customer_reviews.title: The fingers work pretty well, but since they are thick gloves
customer_reviews.text: These are very well fitting and warm. The fingers work pretty well, but since they are thick gloves, they're not the best in the world. Also, all my finger tips are black, not one that is grey.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are my gloves, the ones I wear all the time!
customer_reviews.author: rickkirk

customer_reviews.title: the touchscreen capability is not that great. I have yet to test the gloves after ...
customer_reviews.text: Very thick and comfy! the touchscreen capability is not that great. I have yet to test the gloves after getting them wet.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall Brantley IV

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Pretty small for a Large. But the rest is good
customer_reviews.author: Renzo

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good gloves for warmth but unable to text well with them on.
customer_reviews.author: Kimmie

customer_reviews.title: ... having trouble keeping his hands warm and these work great. Not to hot
customer_reviews.text: My husband was having trouble keeping his hands warm and these work great. Not to hot, but warm for him.
customer_reviews.author: skm

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, but for the cost
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, but for the cost, I wish they were a tad bit more comfortable. The interior material is a bit harsh.
customer_reviews.author: R. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Comfy but poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I really like the fit and the material, and the touch censor on the fingers is a nice touch for phones, but the quality of construction is pretty awful. The thumb seam already ripped on my left hand, and the water proof pad on the palm of the right is already coming off. This might be normal wear and tear, but I've only had then a week. Maybe they aren't cut out for Chicago winter and being worn everyday, but they are not very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: John F.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great fit for large hands works well for the smart phone
customer_reviews.author: willa mae dupuis

customer_reviews.title: They look great with a dress or casual coat or jacket
customer_reviews.text: Gave these Timberland gloves as a holiday gift to a friend who absolutely loves them! They are very warm, yet not bulky. They look great with a dress or casual coat or jacket.
customer_reviews.author: LPhilly

customer_reviews.title: Nice Gloves
customer_reviews.text: Nice Gloves, fits as expected and very helpful to overcome cold weather.
customer_reviews.author: Bala

customer_reviews.title: Warm!
customer_reviews.text: Very warm and comfortable. There is also a degree of dexterity in these gloves, which I like.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: I liked them so much
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorites now. I liked them so much. Comfortable, warm ...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gloves review
customer_reviews.text: Gloves run a little big. Anyone knows if these are washable?
customer_reviews.author: Juan T. Myricks

customer_reviews.title: Came as described. Works with touch screens without having ...
customer_reviews.text: Came as described. Works with touch screens without having to take off the gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: Loved them until they were stolen from my car about a week after purchase :/ NOT COOL!!! They really should eliminate the 15 work requirement blah blah blah
customer_reviews.author: Doug W.

customer_reviews.title: Warm, comfortable and not bulky
customer_reviews.text: My husband likes these very much. They are warm but not bulky and very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: L Potter

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice warm gloves, ended up exchanging a large for a medium and both pair shipped fast.
customer_reviews.author: C. Warren

customer_reviews.title: Very stylish
customer_reviews.text: These are stylish gloves that look sharp with both casual clothing and more dressed looks. The touchscreen feature isn't that great though.
customer_reviews.author: Ice Water

customer_reviews.title: Gloves are warm but Touchscreen fingers....
customer_reviews.text: I am a runner and wanted to be able to work my IPhone while running: music and a tracking program. First, the gloves keep your hands warm. The are not very flexible, though, and have large fingertips. Which makes tapping icon's on the screen a difficult target shooting affair. And the Touchscreen fingertips do not work well on my Iphone 4 (heat transfer wise) which was the main reason I bought these gloves. So I do not consider these gloves a good purchase for operating electronic devices. But they keep my hands warm so 2 stars. I may re-gift them......
customer_reviews.author: Stephen A. Lowe

customer_reviews.title: Warm and Functional
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are very warm even in high winds! They are also very accurate on a touch screen so I don't have to freeze my hand off answering/using my phone or changing songs on my iPod. However I was slightly disappointed to find that they only have touch functionality on the thumb and index but that's basically all you need unless you like to play multi touch tablet games in the snow... They look really nice, it's not hard to attain a nice grip and they fit my long hands perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: I gave these gloves as a Christmas present. My dad unwrapped them and immediately put them on and grabbed his smart phone. Nothing. Not sure if we got a defective pair or what but look somewhere else (possibly in person so you can try for yourself) for touchscreen gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia Rose

customer_reviews.title: These are great!
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my boyfriend to help him fight the Chicago winter. He loves them. I've tried them on and they are incredibly warm, but not restricting like some more serious gloves can be. The touch pads work great on smart phones - making the ability to use your phone in the frigid midwest winters possible! Highly Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan D Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, comfortable gloves. Not too warm, but OK. The touchscreen tips leave a lot to be desired.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick C. Weidinger

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves, my husband loves them glad I bought 2 pairs
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but other than that very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Warm, and touch screen functionality works. A little snug against my watch, but other than that very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: CoburnVT

customer_reviews.title: Works great with smartphones
customer_reviews.text: Snug gloves, great for the price. First time living in cold weather and these seem to work just fine. Also, work great with smartphones.
customer_reviews.author: GK

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Its well made, keep my hand warm especially for a person like me that come from warm country. I'm using it pretty well now in Europe December
customer_reviews.author: Edgar Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Pretty warm gloves, touch is decent, size XL actually fits, thank goodness. Pretty good-looking too.
customer_reviews.author: Dario R.

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves; fingertips still cold
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with the quality and fit of the gloves. I would give it 5 stars but the finger tips are less protected in cold weather because of the touch tips. I know this is a trade-off for having these types of tips.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer
